comments.author: [eatingclub] vancouver || js
comments.content: Great concept. . .love the seasoning on this and much as I love fish, I'll take this as well. ;)

comments.author: VinnieG
comments.content: I can't wait to try this recipe out!  It looks absolutely amazing.

comments.author: Daelyn
comments.content: Oooooh I would love to try this!  Thanks for the recipe!  :-)

comments.author: Katie
comments.content: Oh wow, this looks really yummy. But tedious. Was it hard to make this? I have issues with tofu soaking up flavor when you pan fry it. I might try this, but I am not a spicy food person. I will probably leave out the jalapenos!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hey Katie - it goes pretty quick; the slashes don't have to take more than say 30 seconds per piece of tofu to make.You can certainly skip the jalapenos.

comments.author: James
comments.content: I really wanted to accentuate the fish idea, so I omitted the sauce and instead braised the tofu in a slightly watered down (so as not to overpower the flavour) vegan dashi and I added nori sprinkles to the seasonings. It made it that little bit more oceanic.

comments.author: Danielle
comments.content: This looks amazing! Do you think it would still taste great without the bell peppers? Unfortunately, I'm allergic. Thanks!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Oh, sure, you could omit the peppers and it would still be good.
